subject: Perl 5.20 released
header: A few days later than expected, but perl 5.20 has been released. It is available from CPAN in source code format.
YAPC::NA finally has a preliminary version of its schedule. It also has a list of courses available before

chapters.title: GitTip profile of the week
chapters.header: GitTip allows you to give a regular weekly monetary gift to people in order to encourage them to do more of the awesome stuff they have been doing. The gifts can be as low as 1 cent a week. In this section every week you will see a different Perl developer we recommend you support. Oh, and the Perl Weekly itself also has a GitTip account.

entries.title: CPAN Testers on Gittip
entries.text: Barbie got control over the Twitter account called @cpantesters, and now he has set up a Gittip account as well. By supporting the team you help with the maintenance of the servers and infrastructure of the CPAN Testers.

entries.title: perl 5.20 released
entries.text: Many improvements, including experimental Subroutine signatures. Go ahead compile it from source and start using it. Soon after the announcement David Farrell posted a short overview of what you need to know about perl 5.20.

entries.title: Modification of a read-only value attempted
entries.text: While refactoring a large code-base, domm has encountered this error. It turns out it was a bug in DBIx::Class::Schema::Loader clobbering $_. Besides that, I'd say: Using $_ explicitely is usually not a good ide.

entries.title: Introspection in Devel::Trepan
entries.text: Listing names of functions while debugging by Rocky Bernstein.

entries.title: Reading Code - Camel-Snake-Kebab
entries.text: Eric Johnson is converting variable names among CamelCase,  snake_case, and kebab-case.

TAP is one of the awesome things born out of the Perl ecosystem that  turned out to be nifty enough to sneak out and colonize other projects.  Su-Shee talks here of its use with databases, Postgres, more specifically. ~yanick
entries.title: Database Unit-Testing with PGTAP
Writing Webapps with Perl Dancer
entries.text: A 50 min introduction to Perl Dancer, by Yanick Champoux, the other editor of the Perl Weekly.

entries.title: 2014.21: NLPW2014 recordings, release, optimization, GTK and Cairo
entries.text: The regular Perl 6 weekly by Timo Paulssen.

entries.title: How to build a dynamic web application using PSGI
entries.text: A simple example creating an application that can echo a string.
